Uses of Package
edu.xtec.jclic.boxes

  • Packages that use edu.xtec.jclic.boxes 
    Package Description
    edu.xtec.jclic  
    edu.xtec.jclic.activities.text  
    edu.xtec.jclic.automation  
    edu.xtec.jclic.automation.arith

  • Classes in edu.xtec.jclic.boxes used by edu.xtec.jclic 
    Class and Description
    AbstractBox
    This abstract class is the base for most graphic components of JClic.
    ActiveBagContent
    This class stores a collection of ActiveBoxContent objects, currently in a ArrayList, and provides methods to manage it.
    ActiveBox
    Objects of this class are widely used in JClic activities: cells in puzzles and associations, messages and other objects are active boxes.
    ActiveBoxBag
    This class is a special case of BoxBag, containing only ActiveBox objects.
    ActiveBoxContent
    This class defines a content that can be displayed by ActiveBox objects.
    BoxConnector
    BoxConnector allows users to visually connect two ActiveBox objects in a Activity.Panel.
    TextGridContent
    This class encapsulates the content of TextGridContent objects.
  • Classes in edu.xtec.jclic.boxes used by edu.xtec.jclic.activities.text 
    Class and Description
    ActiveBagContent
    This class stores a collection of ActiveBoxContent objects, currently in a ArrayList, and provides methods to manage it.
    ActiveBoxContent
    This class defines a content that can be displayed by ActiveBox objects.
    BoxBase
    This class contains all the main visual attributes needed to draw AbstractBox objects: background and foreground color and gradient, colors for special states (inactive, alternative, disabled...), mrgins, fonts, strokes for borders, etc.
    JPanelActiveBox
    This class is a JPanel tha contains a single ActiveBox.
  • Classes in edu.xtec.jclic.boxes used by edu.xtec.jclic.automation 
    Class and Description
    ActiveBagContent
    This class stores a collection of ActiveBoxContent objects, currently in a ArrayList, and provides methods to manage it.

  • Classes in edu.xtec.jclic.boxes used by edu.xtec.jclic.beans 
    Class and Description
    AbstractBox
    This abstract class is the base for most graphic components of JClic.
    BoxBase
    This class contains all the main visual attributes needed to draw AbstractBox objects: background and foreground color and gradient, colors for special states (inactive, alternative, disabled...), mrgins, fonts, strokes for borders, etc.
  • Classes in edu.xtec.jclic.boxes used by edu.xtec.jclic.boxes 
    Class and Description
    AbstractBox
    This abstract class is the base for most graphic components of JClic.
    ActiveBagContent
    This class stores a collection of ActiveBoxContent objects, currently in a ArrayList, and provides methods to manage it.
    ActiveBagContentControlPanel 
    ActiveBagContentEditor 
    ActiveBox
    Objects of this class are widely used in JClic activities: cells in puzzles and associations, messages and other objects are active boxes.
    ActiveBoxBag
    This class is a special case of BoxBag, containing only ActiveBox objects.
    ActiveBoxContent
    This class defines a content that can be displayed by ActiveBox objects.
    ActiveBoxGrid
    This class is a ActiveBoxBag with constructors that take an argument of type Shaper to build all its ActiveBox elements.
    BoxBag
    A BoxBag is a class derived from AbstractBox that contains a collection of "boxes" (objects also derived from AbstractBox).
    BoxBase
    This class contains all the main visual attributes needed to draw AbstractBox objects: background and foreground color and gradient, colors for special states (inactive, alternative, disabled...), mrgins, fonts, strokes for borders, etc.
    Resizable
    This interface applies to all the objects that have "bounds" (location, witdh and height) and can be resized or moved.
    TextGrid
    This class is a special ActiveBox that displays a grid of single characters.
    TextGridContent
    This class encapsulates the content of TextGridContent objects.
    ThumbsExplorerPanel.ThumbElement
